requirements.summary: Update the production version identifier to Version 2 in the static version file while keeping the Routes line aligned to the app’s core routes.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/app-version.txt` retains a valid `Routes:` line matching the app’s core routes (/, /learn, /guided-forms, /contact).

file_operations.description: Change the first line from `Version 3` to exactly `Version 2`; keep the existing `Routes: /, /learn, /guided-forms, /contact` line unchanged and consistent with the current router.

requirements.summary: Update deployment documentation to indicate Version 2 is the current live release target.

file_operations.description: Update the `### Current Version:` line to `### Current Version: Version 2` and adjust any nearby version-specific wording that would otherwise contradict the current version declaration (without adding unrelated release notes).

requirements.summary: Ensure the post-deploy smoke check script is ready to be run against the production base URL and verifies all core routes return HTTP 2xx/3xx.

file_operations.description: Confirm the script’s route list matches the production core routes (`/`, `/learn`, `/guided-forms`, `/contact`) and keep behavior to exit 0 only when all checks return HTTP 2xx/3xx; update inline usage text if needed to reflect the correct invocation path (`node frontend/scripts/postdeploy-smoke-check.mjs <production-base-url>`).

Add a short runbook documenting exactly how to run `node frontend/scripts/postdeploy-smoke-check.mjs <production-base-url>` after deployment and how to interpret exit code 0 vs non-zero, explicitly listing the checked routes (`/`, `/learn`, `/guided-forms`, `/contact`).
